item.title: ZywOo Passes S1mple in Major Counter-Strike Milestone
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/zywoo-passes-s1mple-in-major-counter-strike-milestone/

The Counter-Strike GOAT debate may never end, but French prodigy Mathieu “ZywOo” Herbaut has reasserted his case, passing a record held by the one and only Oleksandr “s1mple” Kostyljev. However, it could very well be CS2’s fastest rising star that eventually claims the record for himself.

ZywOo Sets Counter-Strike Record for Most Tournament MVP Trophies

At ESL Pro League Season 21, Vitality added their second trophy of the year to their case, after claiming IEM Katowice just a month prior. ZywOo was named MVP of both tournaments by HLTV, bringing his MVP career total to 22, passing s1mple’s record of 2021.

To put in perspective how dominant s1mple was in his prime, his most recent MVP award was from IEM Cologne 2022. He hasn’t won an MVP award in more than two years, while ZywOo has won a staggering nine since the start of 2023, and only now has the French superstar finally passed s1mple. S1mple still owns the record for most MVP awards won in a single year, after winning eight in 2021, the same year where he finally won the Major. Both s1mple and ZywOo are also tied with just a single Major win, but ZywOo is in the better position to win a second considering how dominant Vitality is looking to start 2025.

“I’m one ahead of s1mple,” ZywOo told HLTV after winning ESL Pro League Season 21. “I will just keep going, keep grinding, and I will never stop just because I am one in front. I will just show I can go 25, 30 MVPs.”

Right now s1mple’s career is at a crossroads. The 27-year-old is still officially on the NAVI bench, and hasn’t played in a professional match since November during his loan to Falcons. Either ZywOo will set a standard so high that no one will catch it, or a new contender for GOAT status will emerge. The player many are watching out for is Danil “donk” Kryshkovets, the rising star of Team Spirit, after a 2024 rookie campaign that saw him win a record-breaking Major and five MVP awards. Still, even if he maintains the pace he set last year, it will take him years to catch up to ZywOo’s record, and that’s assuming the French star stops winning. And given that he’s still only 24, I wouldn’t bet on it.

Will any player ever catch ZywOo’s MVP numbers? Is he the GOAT of Counter-Strike? Let us know in the comments or on the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Insider Gaming esports, check out our coverage of the Esports World Cup 2025 Club Partners Program announcement.

item.title: First Look At Johnny Cage, Kitana, and Shao Kahn In Mortal Kombat 2
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/first-look-at-johnny-cage-kitana-and-shao-kahn-in-mortal-kombat-2/

A first look at classic Mortal Kombat characters in the upcoming movie has been revealed. In a new exclusive from Entertainment Weekly, Warner Bros. Pictures has released the first look at Johnny Cage, Kitana, and Shao Kahn in Mortal Kombat 2.

Johnny Cage will be played by Karl Urban from The Boys. Resident Evil star Adeline Rudolph plays Kitana while House of David actor Martyn Ford is Shao Kahn.

You can check out the new characters below (click to enlarge).

Mortal Kombat 2 is the follow up to 2021’s Mortal Kombat. After the first move followed Shang Tsung’s goal of killing Earth’s fighters before the tournament began, the sequel is where the tournament happens. Earth is at risk of losing its 10th-straight tournament. Should that happen, Shao Kahn will invade the planet and take over.

In addition to the tournament itself, franchise co-creator Ed Boon says that the battle between Scorpion and Sub-Zero isn’t finished.

PODCAST: Meet The Creator Behind Call of Duty Skill-Based Matchmaking—Insider Gaming Weekly

“He’s certainly making appearances that are significant and necessary for the progress of other storylines,” Boon told Entertainment Weekly. “He plays a different role. He’s not part of the ‘Super Friends’ trying to defeat Shao Kahn, but his appearance is key and it is very essential for certain parts.”

And though they’ve given fans a look at three new characters coming in Mortal Kombat 2, they aren’t the only ones that will find themselves on the big screen. Jade and Queen Sindel will also play a role in the movie along with “other” characters that haven’t been announced yet.

Mortal Kombat 2 is scheduled to release in theaters on October 24.

For more Insider Gaming, read about Ubisoft seeking investors for a new entity. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.
